content.description: One of the best for the grade at SoMo.  Fun compression problem, with moves getting progressively harder.  If not for the rock quality and proximity to a back slapping boulder, would get four stars.  Sit start compressed between left hand side pull undercling on the arete and right hand on jug side pull.  Move up (compressing) with crimps, slopers and side pulls. Left heel hook intensive.  Committing last two moves.
content.protection: 3 or more full pads best. Piece of webbing or rope to tie of a pad is nice; this way your back doesn't slam into the  boulders adjacent the climb. Spotter def doesn't hurt.
content.location: If at Afternoon delight, head around the boulder and cut left, passing Catch and Release, and you will be at Weissman Score.  From Afternoon Delight, WS can't be more than 30 yards.

content.description: Start as for Diaper Rash. Move right onto overhanging face and topout. Slightly reachy
content.location: The Diaper Rash problems sit at the bottom of the hillside with Afternoon Delight just above and right.

content.description: To the right of catch and release. SDS on broken jug. Work straight out the overhang on good holds with stout movement.
Start on obvious rail and work to a small edge under the roof. Make a big move out and over the roof.

Sit start with a good left hand side pull and small right hand edge. Top out directly above.This might feel a little easier for taller people who can reach the arete out left. Otherwise you’ll need to work through the slopers above like I had to. PG-13 rating for the rock behind you that could potentially make for a bad day. Once I worked out the moves, I felt like the fall zone was safe and the potential to hit that rock was minimal.
content.location: From Catch and Release, skirt around to the left of the Weissman Score boulder.

content.description: SDS on far left side on obvious low jug and work right into Granite of Deceit. Top out same as Granite of Deceit.The moves leading into Granite of Deceit may feel a bit harder for taller people. Joel and I both felt this goes around V7.There’s potential to fall down left moving off the start hold. See Granite of Deceit for more info.
content.location: See Granite of Deceit for more info.

content.description: Start on thin crimp edge near dihedral and move into crack. Top out same as Depends.
content.location: The Diaper Rash problems sit at the bottom of the hillside with Afternoon Delight just above and right

content.description: Start low and left on an edge for each hand. Move up through good holds to top out. Avoid block to right with feet for full value.
content.location: The Diaper Rash problems sit at the bottom of the hillside with Afternoon Delight just above and right

content.description: Start matched on sidepull/crimp feature. A few big moves to gain the lip. The crux is releasing the right hand to match on the lip
Start low and left with hands on slopey feature. Traverse right and around slight arete to top out at the hueco.
Pile of rocks on the left side if you are walking from the bench
